info.title: Zite DB REST API
info.description:
A REST API for managing Zite databases, tables, fields, and records. Build database-driven applications with programmatic access to your structured data.

## What is REST API

A **REST API** simplifies interaction with your database data, allowing for automation and integration. Following RESTful principles, it seamlessly connects to retrieve, create, and modify database data.

## Getting Started

### Authentication
All API requests require authentication using your Fillout API key in the Authorization header:
```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

### Base URLs
- **US**: https://tables.fillout.com/api/v1
- **EU**: https://eu-tables.fillout.com/api/v1

### Rate Limits
API requests are rate limited to ensure service quality. Standard rate limits apply to all endpoints.

### Error Handling
The API returns standard HTTP status codes and JSON error responses with detailed error messages.

bearerAuth.description: Enter your Fillout API key. Format: Bearer <api_key>

id.description: Unique UUID identifier for the database

tables.description: List of tables in the database

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the database was created

updatedAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the database was last updated

primaryFieldId.description: ID of the primary field in the table

fields.description: List of fields in the table

views.description: List of views in the table

type.description: Field type - see [Field Types Reference](/help/database/field-types) for complete list of available types and their configurations

template.description: Field-specific configuration options. See [Field Types Reference](/help/database/field-types) for detailed template structure by field type.

hiddenFieldIds.description: Array of field IDs that are hidden in this view

fieldWidths.description: Field width configuration for the view

orderedFieldIds.description: Array of field IDs in the order they appear in this view

id.description: Unique UUID identifier for the record

fields.description: Record data with field names as keys

record.description: Record data with field IDs as keys

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the record was created

updatedAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the record was last updated

tables.description: Array of table definitions to create with the database

fields.description: Array of field definitions to create with the table

template.description: Field-specific configuration options. See [Field Types Reference](/help/database/field-types) for detailed template structure by field type.

fields.description: Array of field definitions to create with the table

type.description: Field type - see [Field Types Reference](/help/database/field-types) for available options

template.description: Field-specific configuration options (optional - uses defaults if not provided). See [Field Types Reference](/help/database/field-types) for detailed template structure by field type.

label.description: The display text for the option

color.description: Color key for the option. If not specified, a color will be auto-assigned. Available colors: purple, orange, blue, gray, red, yellow, green, pink, lime, tangerine, emerald, sky, teal, indigo, cyan, violet, fuchsia. Each color has a specific background and text color combination (e.g., purple uses #EEE6F3 background with #401DB3 text).

value.description: Unique identifier for the option. Not specified when creating new options. Useful in write operations when specifying existing options (e.g., reordering options, keeping old options and adding new ones).

template.description: Updated field configuration. See [Field Types Reference](/help/database/field-types) for detailed template structure by field type.

record.description: Record data with field names or field IDs as keys and their corresponding values
Fields to update with their new values (using field names or field IDs as keys). Only include fields you want to change.

limit.description: Number of records to return (default: 500, max: 2000)

offset.description: Number of records to skip for pagination

sort.description: Array of sort objects. When not provided, records are returned in ascending order by creation time (createdAt ASC). All queries include an internal tie-breaker to ensure deterministic ordering across paginated requests.

filter.description: Filter condition to query records. Supports nested AND/OR logic. Each condition requires `field` (field ID or name) and one operator (`equals`, `does_not_equal`, `contains`, `greater_than`, `in`, etc.). See [Filtering documentation](/database/list-records#filtering) for details.

total.description: Total number of records matching the query

hasMore.description: Whether there are more records available beyond this page

fieldId.description: Field ID or system field name (id, createdAt, updatedAt)

FilterCondition.description: A filter condition that can be a single field condition or a logical group (and/or) of conditions. Each field condition requires a field name/ID and exactly one operator.

field.description: Field ID or field name to filter on

and.description: Array of conditions that must ALL match (logical AND)

or.description: Array of conditions where ANY must match (logical OR)

equals.description: Exact match. Supported by: text, number, date, selection, checkbox fields.

does_not_equal.description: Not equal to value. Supported by: text, number, date, selection, checkbox fields.

contains.description: Contains substring (text) or has value (multi-select, linked record). Supported by: text, selection, linked record fields.

does_not_contain.description: Does not contain substring or value. Supported by: text, selection, linked record fields.

starts_with.description: Starts with string. Supported by: text fields.

ends_with.description: Ends with string. Supported by: text fields.

is_empty.description: Field has no value (pass true). Supported by: all field types.

is_not_empty.description: Field has a value (pass true). Supported by: all field types.

in.description: Value is in array. Supported by: text, number, selection, linked record fields.

not_in.description: Value is not in array. Supported by: text, number, selection, linked record fields.

greater_than.description: Greater than value. Supported by: number, date fields.

greater_than_or_equal_to.description: Greater than or equal to value. Supported by: number, date fields.

less_than.description: Less than value. Supported by: number, date fields.

less_than_or_equal_to.description: Less than or equal to value. Supported by: number, date fields.

WebhookEventType.description: The type of database event that triggers the webhook

secret.description: The webhook secret for HMAC signature verification. Only returned once on creation.

url.description: The URL to receive webhook POST requests

events.description: Array of event types to subscribe to

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the event occurred

webhookId.description: ID of the webhook that triggered this delivery

attempt.description: Delivery attempt number (1 for first attempt)
